bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from Robert P. Cooke to George A. Kellogg, August 9, 1941

div1.p: Cooke approves of Cornwell's painting, "Conquerors of Yellow Fever," and requests more copies.

div1.head: Letter from Robert P. Cooke to George A. Kellogg, August 9, 1941
div1.opener:
C O P Y
COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA
State Dept of Health
Lexington Rockbridge Health Dept.
Lexington, Virginia
August 9, 1941
Mr. George A. Kellogg
Jersey City, N J.
My dear Mr. Kellogg
div1.p:
Accept my thanks for the fine newspaper
reproduction of Dean Cornwell's painting. Some
of the characters are easily recognizable, es-
pecially Lazear, Finlay and Agramonte. If I
could have a copy of the reproduction, as you
so kindly suggest, when they are ready I would
reatly appreciate and value it.
